scenes.background: [Monica] raises an eyebrow after discussing your availability during breaks.
scenes.description: Bob leans forward. 'Do you think a rotation system will actually solve our problems?'

options.text: It's a start. We can refine it as we go based on feedback.
options.analysis: You show good social skills by proposing a flexible solution but may lack some motivation to directly engage with the situation.

options.text: I believe so. It ensures no one is overloaded and we always have coverage.
options.analysis: You demonstrate responsibility and motivation but might compromise your self-regulation and empathy by overcommitting.

options.text: It could, but we still need a clear definition of what constitutes 'urgent'.
options.analysis: You show empathy by seeking clarity but may come off as less proactive and socially skilled.
